2.text: “Shouldn’t the multitude of words be answered? Should a man full of talk be justified?

3.text: Should your boastings make men hold their peace? When you mock, shall no man make you ashamed?

4.text: For you say, ‘My doctrine is pure. I am clean in your eyes.’

5.text: But oh that God would speak, and open his lips against you,

6.text: that he would show you the secrets of wisdom! For true wisdom has two sides. Know therefore that God exacts of you less than your iniquity deserves.

7.text: “Can you fathom the mystery of God? Or can you probe the limits of the Almighty?

8.text: They are high as heaven. What can you do? They are deeper than Sheol. What can you know?

9.text: Its measure is longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.

10.text: If he passes by, or confines, or convenes a court, then who can oppose him?

11.text: For he knows false men. He sees iniquity also, even though he doesn’t consider it.

12.text: An empty-headed man becomes wise when a man is born as a wild donkey’s colt.

13.text: “If you set your heart aright, stretch out your hands toward him.

14.text: If iniquity is in your hand, put it far away. Don’t let unrighteousness dwell in your tents.

15.text: Surely then you shall lift up your face without spot; Yes, you shall be steadfast, and shall not fear:

16.text: for you shall forget your misery. You shall remember it as waters that are passed away.

17.text: Life shall be clearer than the noonday. Though there is darkness, it shall be as the morning.

18.text: You shall be secure, because there is hope. Yes, you shall search, and shall take your rest in safety.

19.text: Also you shall lie down, and none shall make you afraid. Yes, many shall court your favor.

20.text: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail. They shall have no way to flee. Their hope shall be the giving up of the spirit.”
